title: [K-12] Greek Teacher Training Program for Strengthening Collaborative Writing Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Greek grammar and teaching experience
context.additional_context: Teacher professional development program applying MOOCs and collaborative learning methodologies in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners acquire the ability to design collaborative writing activities using Google Docs.

Learners can build a connectivist learning community for knowledge sharing among teachers using online platforms (e.g., Padlet, Google Classroom) over four weeks, upload content at least twice weekly, provide at least three peer feedbacks, and achieve community activity metrics (participation rate over 80%, interaction frequency over ten times).

Learners can develop three engagement-inducing scenarios for middle/high school students (ages 10â€“15) using digital educational tools (quiz platforms, interactive videos, etc.), and achieve an average suitability score of over 4 out of 5 on a peer-reviewed and teacher-verified 5-point scale.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
